question.text: Select the answer with the CORRECT matching of the structure, its location, and function.

options.text:
Structure Location Function
Eustachian tube The anterior part of the internal ear Equalizes air pressure on either side of the tympanic membrane

Structure Location Function
Cerebellum Midbrain Controls respiration and gastric secretions

Structure Location Function
Hypothalamus Forebrain Controls body temperature, urge for eating and drinking

Structure Location Function
Blindspot Near the place where the optic nerve leaves the eye Rods and cones are present but inactive here

solution.text: The eustachian tube is a canal that is located in the para pharyngeal space (front wall of the middle ear) and ventilates the middle ear. The cerebellum is a structure of the hindbrain and controls voluntary movements, balance, and co-ordination. The hypothalamus is a part of the forebrain and is responsible for controlling the body temperature and releasing hormones. A blind spot is a tiny pinhead size of an area where the optic nerve passes through the surface of the retina which is devoid of the photoreceptors and therefore no image is detected in this area.
